title: Curse Voice
body: Is Curse Voice allowed? Will it trigger a cheating ban? Will it crash my client? Etc.

replies.body:
Curse Voice hasn't historically provided any cheats or competitive advantages, so as long as it doesn't in the future, you should be clear to use it. Sometimes it's caused crashing or other weird interacts in the past, but I'm not aware of any conflicts between it and League at the moment.

Let me know if you have any questions.

I'm really just being cautious of using other programs that might be flagged as a false-positive. I don't want to go through weeks of conflict in a support ticket and lose my account because of cheating that I did not do.
False positives are pretty rare in my experience, but if you're that worried, you may want to look at other VOIPs such as Discord, Teamspeak or Mumble.

With false-positives, what are the chances of getting a ban repealed? If it truly is a false-positive. I'm really just getting paranoid because of all the time I've had on this account, and the content on the account, I wouln't want it banned for something stupid like a false-positive ban for cheating.

Fale positives are so rare, I've never seen one personally, so I'm very confident one is not likely to happen. I would imagine that if one happened, it would be fairly apparent after we did some investigating in a support ticket, and we would act on the data we gathered.

Let me know if that cleared it up for you.

I think I have encountered a false positive on my account that just got permanently banned for using "malicious 3rd party software". The only 3rd party software I know that gives an in-game overlay is curse voice. I read on an archived post that Riot was working with Curse to ensure this wouldn't happen, which was in 2014. Also, Curse is not clearly outlined as a malicious 3rd party software. If you could get into contact with me at jaimejustin98@gmail.com I would appreciate it greatly
